sen.j: 園基福（その もとよし、元和 (日本)8年2月16日 (旧暦)（1622年3月27日）－元禄12年11月10日 (旧暦)（1699年12月30日））は、江戸時代前期の公卿。
sen.e: Motoyoshi SONO (March 23, 1622 - December 30, 1699) was a kugyo (court noble) during the early Edo period.
Motoyoshi SONO (March 23, 1622 - December 30, 1699) was a Kugyo (court noble) during the early Edo period.
Motoyoshi SONO (March 23, 1622 - December 30, 1699) was a Kugyo (court noble) during the early Edo period.

sen.j: 霊元天皇の伯父にあたる人物。
sen.e: He is an uncle of Emperor Reigen.
He was an uncle of Emperor Reigen.
He was an uncle of Emperor Reigen.

sen.j: 主に明正天皇（109代）から東山天皇（113代）までの五帝にわたり仕えた廷臣で官位は従一位准大臣まで昇った。
sen.e: He was a retainer of the Imperial Court who served five emperors from Emperor Meisho (109th) to Emperor Higashiyama (113th) and promoted to the rank of Juichii Jun-daijin (Vice Minister in the Junior First Rank).

He was a retainer of the Imperial Court who served five emperors from Empress Meisho (109th) to Emperor Higashiyama (113th), and was promoted to the rank of Juichii Jun-daijin (Junior First Rank, Vice Minister).

He was a retainer of the Imperial Court who served five emperors from Empress Meisho (109th) to Emperor Higashiyama (113th), and was promoted to the rank of Juichii Jun-daijin (Junior First Rank, Vice Minister).

sen.j: 父は権大納言園基音（薨去後左大臣追贈）。
sen.e: His father was Motonari SONO, Gon Dainagon (provisional major counselor); he was conferred post-humously the the position of sadaijin (Minister of the left) after his death.
His father was Motonari SONO, Gon Dainagon (Provisional Chief Councilor of State); he was posthumously conferred the post of Sadaijin (Minister of the Left).
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: His father was Motonari SONO, Gon Dainagon (Provisional Chief Councilor of State); he was posthumously conferred the post of Sadaijin (Minister of the Left).

sen.j: 母は山家藩主谷衛友の娘。
sen.e: His mother was a daughter of Moritomo TANI, the lord of the Yamaga Domain.
His mother was a daughter of Moritomo TANI, the lord of Yamaga Domain.
His mother was a daughter of Moritomo TANI, the lord of Yamaga Domain.

sen.j: 妹に新広義門院（後水尾天皇典侍・霊元天皇生母）がいる。
sen.e: His younger sister was Shinkogimonin, Naishi no suke (a court lady of the first rank) of Emperor Gomizunoo (she was akso the mother of Emperor Reigen).
His younger sister was Shinkogimonin, Naishi no suke (a court lady of the first rank) of Emperor Gomizunoo and the biological mother of Emperor Reigen.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: His younger sister was Shinkogimonin, Naishi no suke (a court lady of the first rank) of Emperor Gomizunoo and the biological mother of Emperor Reigen.

sen.j: 室は権大納言中御門尚長の娘。
sen.e: His wife was a daughter of Naonaga NAKAMIKADO, Gon Dainagon (provisional major counselor).
His wife was a daughter of Naonaga NAKAMIKADO, Gon Dainagon.
sen.cmt: 権大納言は初出ではないため補足説明を削除しました。
sen.e: His wife was a daughter of Naonaga NAKAMIKADO, Gon Dainagon.

sen.j: 継室は備後福山藩主水野勝俊の娘。
sen.e: His keishitsu (second wife) was a daughter of Katsutoshi MIZUNO, the lord of the Bigofukuyama Domain.
His keishitsu (the second wife) was a daughter of Katsutoshi MIZUNO, the lord of Bingofukuyama Domain.
sen.cmt: the Bigofukuyama -> Bingofukuyama備後福山は「びんごふくやま」です。
sen.e: His keishitsu (the second wife) was a daughter of Katsutoshi MIZUNO, the lord of Bingofukuyama Domain.

sen.j: 子に権大納言園基勝、右近衛少将六角基維がいる。
sen.e: His sons were Motokatsu SONO, Gon Dainagon (provisional major counselor) and 基維 ROKKAKU, Ukone-no-shosho (Minor Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards).
His sons were Motokatsu SONO, Gon Dainagon and Mototsuna ROKKAKU, Ukone no Shosho (Minor Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards).
sen.cmt: 基維の読みは「もとつな/もとただ/もとしげ」などが考えられますが、確認できる資料は見つかりませんでした。英文は「もとつな」としています。
sen.e: His sons were Motokatsu SONO, Gon Dainagon and Mototsuna ROKKAKU, Ukone no Shosho (Minor Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards).
He was conferred a peerage in 1626.
He was conferred a peerage in 1626.

sen.j: 以降累進し、侍従・左近衛少将・左近衛中将・蔵人頭を経て、慶安2年（1649年）に参議となり、公卿に列する。
sen.e: After that, he promoted from the member of Palace staff to Sakone-no-shosho (Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards), Sakone-no-chujo (Middle Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards), Kurodo-no-to (Head Chamberlain) and in 1649, became Sangi (councillor), position ranked with kugyo.

After the conferment, he was promoted from Jiju (Imperial Household Agency staff) to Sakone no Shosho (Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards), Sakone no Chujo (Middle Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards), Kurodo no To (Head Chamberlain), and he joined Kugyo in 1649 as he became Sangi (Councilor).
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: After the conferment, he was promoted from Jiju (Imperial Household Agency staff) to Sakone no Shosho (Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards), Sakone no Chujo (Middle Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards), Kurodo no To (Head Chamberlain), and he joined Kugyo in 1649 as he became Sangi (Councilor).

sen.j: その後、踏歌節会外弁・権中納言を経て、万治3年（1660年）に権大納言となる。
sen.e: Subsequently, he became Toka no sechie Geben (a kugyo who supervised many matters outside the Imperial Court Ceremony, called Jomei Gate at Toka no sechie) and Gon Chunagon (Provisional Middle Counselor), in 1660, became Gon Dainagon (provisional major counselor).

Later, he became Toka no sechie (Circle-Dancing Banquet: the last of the First Month's three great banquets [sechie] which formerly took place from the fourteenth to the sixteenth of January in the Shishinden [the Throne Hall] of the Imperial Court under the moonlight) Geben (a Kugyo who supervised the Imperial Court Ceremony outside of Jomei Gate) and Gon Chunagon (Provisional Vice-councilor of State), and he became Gon Dainagon in1660.

sen.e: Later, he became Toka no sechie (Circle-Dancing Banquet: the last of the First Month's three great banquets [sechie] which formerly took place from the fourteenth to the sixteenth of January in the Shishinden [the Throne Hall] of the Imperial Court under the moonlight) Geben (a Kugyo who supervised the Imperial Court Ceremony outside of Jomei Gate) and Gon Chunagon (Provisional Vice-councilor of State), and he became Gon Dainagon in1660.

sen.j: 寛文9年（1669年）まで務め、貞享3年（1686年）には従一位となり、羽林家としては異例の准大臣に叙せられた。
sen.e: He served until 1669 and was given a rank of juichii (Junior First Rank) in 1686 and was conferred a rank of Jun-daijin (Vice Minister), which was an exceptional case for a member of the Urin family.

He served the position until 1669 and was conferred a rank of Juichii (Junior First Rank) in 1686 and lastly Jun Daijin (Vice Minister), which was the unprecedented promotion for a member of the Urin family.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。「最終的には准大臣に叙せられた」と解釈しました。
sen.e: He served the position until 1669 and was conferred a rank of Juichii (Junior First Rank) in 1686 and lastly Jun Daijin (Vice Minister), which was the unprecedented promotion for a member of the Urin family.

sen.j: 霊元天皇の伯父にあたるためである。
sen.e: The appointment of this position was due to his relation with Emperor Reigen as an uncle.
The reason for his appointment of this position was that he was the uncle of Emperor Reigen.
